alert.note: Alert for Carroll (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 4:17AM EDT until May 01 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following counties, Cumberland, Knox, Lincoln, Sagadahoc, Waldo and York. Portions of New Hampshire, including the following counties, Carroll, Rockingham and Strafford. * WHEN...Until 200 PM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from heavy rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 414 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Morning commuters should plan for additional travel times due to increased risk of road closures and detours across the warning area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern and coastal Maine including Portland, Rochester, South Portland, Biddeford, Portsmouth, Brunswick, Westbrook, Kittery, Bath and Rockland.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
